column4: so, any tutorials on setting up ssh so i can access my comp from any windows computer?
is ssh installed?
if it is, just start it with /etc/init.d/sshd start
im looking for  atutorial for it...
sudo apt-get install openssh or ssh or sshd.  i forget which is the Ubuntu package
then /etc/init.d/sshd start
it should config your keys for you on first start
then, as long as iptables or a firewall isn't blocking it, you should be able to connect
keys??...this is all new to me...most ive done is tried to connect to another computer on my LAN
did you install an ssh server?
it is REALLY simple
ill give it a shot.
install the server (openssh sshd ssh or something) then start the service and you are done
ssh needs secret keys for the 'handshake' but Ubuntu takes care of that automatically, i believe
just run '/etc/init.d/sshd start' and you can connect once the server is installed
kk, thanks. i want to be able to listen to my music at school, from my computer XD this will help  right?
um... maybe
you *can* stream tunes through ssh
but you might want to check out mpd or icecast for what you want to do
kk
i have never done what you are trying.  ssh will get you in the door to copy stuff, however
